asked the Minister for the Environment if he will explain the differences, if any, between the severance arrangements available for servants of local authorities if they lose their jobs as a result of cutbacks, and those available for officers of local authorities in the same situation; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: I would refer the Deputy to the very full reply given on 5 November, 1987 to Questions Nos. 68, 33, 41, 44, 51 and 61, by the Minister for Finance in which he gave the complete details of the terms of the voluntary redundancy/early retirement package which is designed to apply over the entire public sector, including local authorities. The summary of the package which has been circulated with that reply indicates the terms available under the various categories.

The main differences in so far as officers and employees (servants) are concerned occur in relation to staff with at least 5 years and less than 40 years service, taking account of the different rates of PRSI payable by them. As the Deputy is aware, a local authority officer pays modified PRSI and an employee (servant) pays full PRSI. The various options available to staff in this category are set out fully in the very comprehensive statement circulated by the Minister for Finance and I would refer the Deputy in particular to the details given at (3), (4) and (5) in cols. 2593 to 2596 of the Official Report of 5 November 1987.

asked the Minister for the Environment if it is intended to amalgamate the administrations of Limerick city and county, Waterford city and county and Cork city and county; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: The Government are committed to a renewal of local government, through a streamlining of structures and the granting of important new powers to local authorities to promote and support the development of their areas. I have, accordingly, undertaken a comprehensive review of the local government system and have as part of this process consulted the local government representative bodies. Arising from this review I intend to bring forward a substantial programme of reforms as soon as possible. It would not be appropriate to comment further at this stage on the matter raised by the Deputy.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Dublin Millennium.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Mitchell Mr. G. Mitchell
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if he will ensure that sufficient funds are made available to promote the Dublin Millennium and in particular, to assist local community groups in so doing; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Mitchell Mr. G. Mitchell
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment the plans the Government have to celebrate Dublin's Millennium.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 43 and 48 together.

MainHeading.P: The Government have already announced a special grant of £700,000 towards the celebration of the Dublin City Millennium in 1988. This grant — from the surplus moneys generated by the national lottery — will go to sponsor a series of projects. The projects will be in the areas of arts and culture, community, youth, environmental improvement etc. I can assure the Deputy that there will be substantial aid from this grant for community based projects.

The £700,000 special grant is additional to the £250,000 grant to Dublin Corporation for the repaving of Grafton Street which I announced previously. I will also be giving a special grant of £250,000 to Dublin Corporation in 1988 for improvement works in O'Connell Street. The Government recognise the importance of the millennium celebrations both for the people of Dublin city and for the whole country and I believe that the impressive amount of Government aid which I have now outlined speaks for itself.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment when approval and provision of finance will be made for implementation of the interim flood relief measures for the town of Skibbereen, County Cork as sanctioned by his predecessor in January 1987.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: Contract documents for site investigation work to be carried out in advance of the proposed interim flood relief works in Skibbereen were submitted by Cork County Council in October 1987 and are under examination in my Department. I hope to be in a position to make a decision on these documents shortly. Further consideration of the proposed interim flood relief works must await the outcome of these site investigations.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Higgins Mr. J. Higgins
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if he will give an assurance that all existing house improvement grants approved by his Department will be honoured; and that it is not his intention to set unreasonable deadlines in relation to the completion of works approved under the scheme; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Carey Mr. Carey Mr. Nealon Mr. Nealon
Speaker.P: and Mr. Carey asked the Minister for the Environment if, in view of the widespread apprehension that the Government might terminate the house improvement grants for projects already approved or introduce an early deadline for the completion of work on these projects, he will give an assurance that the grant commitments to approved projects will be honoured irrespective of when the work is completed; and if he will make a statement on the matter to allay the fears of many people.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 46 and 94 together.
I have no proposals to introduce a deadline for the completion of works for which house improvement grants have been approved.

asked the Minister for the Environment if it is his intention to introduce legislation to provide for a four month, or some other defined time limit, for determining a planning appeal; and, if so, when this will be introduced.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: In the interests of both developers and the general public I am anxious that all planning appeals be dealt with in as short a time as possible. However, the imposition of an absolute time limit on An Bord Pleanála without safeguards to deal with extreme cases could give rise to a challenge in the courts on constitutional grounds. I am at present examining all the options open to me including new legislation with a view to having all but the most exceptional cases dealt with in four months. I am not yet in a position to say finally what method or combination of methods I will use to achieve this objective.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Custom House Docks Site.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. O'Malley Mr. P. O'Malley
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if he has satisfied himself that the proposed development of the Custom House Docks site, Dublin will be commercially viable; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: It is the responsibility of the Custom House Docks Development Authority to secure the redevelopment of the Custom House Docks site and, as part of this it is their function to assess the commercial viability of projects. I am satisfied that the Authority are discharging this function satisfactorily. In so far as the question raises the issue of viability, I would point out that the risk in the project lies with the developer consortium and they are committing in the order of £250 million as a measure of their confidence.

asked the Minister for the Environment the number of housing grant inspectors who have been made redundant; the number now employed; and the effect which this has had on the time taken to carry out inspections and to make payments of grants.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: None of the permanent inspectors has been made redundant; 54 continue to be employed. The reduction in the level of inspections consequent on the termination of the house improvement grants scheme in March last has been such that only two of the 70 temporary inspectors specially recruited continue to be employed on grant work. The cessation of their employment has had no adverse effect on the carrying out of inspections or the payment of grants.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - State of the Environment.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if it is proposed to take any steps to issue periodic reports on the state of the environment, as recommended by An Foras Forbartha in their first such report, published in 1985; if he will outline what these steps are; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: While I accept that periodic reports on the state of the environment are useful, I believe that an interval of about five years should be allowed between reports. There is adequate time, therefore, to consider what arrangements should be made for the preparation of future reports.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Urban Renewal Financial Incentives.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment the plans, if any, he has to extend the terms of the Urban Renewal Financial Incentives; the reason the town of Drogheda in County Louth has been excluded from the scheme; if his attention has been drawn to the fact that Drogheda Corporation has completed a new development plan which contains a major contribution and commitment to urban renewal; if his attention has been further drawn to the submissions made by Drogheda Corporation over many years to his Department; if he will consider the situation; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

asked the Minister for the Environment the reason his Department has excluded the town of Drogheda, County Louth from the urban renewal financial scheme; if he will now review his decision; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 54 and 98 together.

MainHeading.P: The decision to designate areas for the purpose of urban renewal incentives in nine new urban centres was taken by the Government following careful consideration of all relevant factors. The towns involved were chosen on the basis of their size and status, geographical distribution, need for urban renewal and prospects for redevelopment. There are, of course, many other towns that could benefit from designation but it was considered that the incentives should be extended to a limited number of urban centres at this stage. The benefit of the whole urban renewal scheme could be dissipated by its application on too widespread a basis. The operation of the scheme including the terms of the financial incentives is being monitored constantly and consideration will be given to future extensions or modifications as circumstances warrant.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if he intends making regulations under the Building Societies (Amendment) Act, 1986 to ensure that borrowers seeking endowment mortgages have freedom of choice of insurance company or broker.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: I have no power under the Building Societies (Amendment) Act, 1986, to make such regulations.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Ease of Access to Public Buildings.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Higgins Mr. M. Higgins
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if he has satisfied himself that the local authorities under his control have taken sufficient measures to ensure ease of access for all physically handicapped people to public buildings for which they have responsibility; if he will ask each local authority to prepare a report on the measures they have taken and propose to take to this end and in respect of their areas; if he will cause such reports to be published; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: Requirements in relation to means of access to and circulation within buildings by disabled persons are prescribed in the proposed building regulations which will have statutory effect on enactment of the Building Control Bill, 1984. In the meantime, local authorities have been asked to treat the draft building regulations as though they had statutory backing and to apply the standards in the draft regulations when designing and constructing buildings.

My Department have also in circulars issued to local authorities, drawn attention to the needs of the disabled in the use of public buildings. Furthermore, the matter receives ongoing attention in the context of individual building projects which require departmental approval.

I am satisfied that local authorities are very conscious of requirements in this matter and that, within expenditure constraints, their response has been satisfactory. I do not consider it necessary to seek a report on the matter from each authority at this stage.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Road Traffic Legislation.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if he will amend the law so that drivers of stolen cars who are involved in collisions resulting in death can be charged with manslaughter; and that tougher penalties for passengers in such cars will be introduced so as to act as a major deterrent to those contemplating this criminal activity; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: The law already provides substantial sanctions for the offences referred to by the Deputy. So far as road traffic law is concerned section 53 of the Road Traffic Act, 1961, as amended, makes it an offence to drive a vehicle, whether stolen or not, in a public place in such a manner as to be a danger to the public. Where dangerous driving causes death or serious bodily harm, the offender is liable, on conviction on indictment, to a maximum penalty of five years imprisonment and/or a £3,000 fine. The provision for an indictable offence in this form was introduced because of the difficulty which had been experienced in securing convictions for manslaughter in dangerous driving cases which resulted in death.

The Director of Public Prosecutions can, at his discretion and depending on the circumstances of the case, opt to take proceedings for manslaughter where somebody is killed as a result of dangerous driving or some other offence such as drunken driving.

MainHeading.P: Both the driver and any passenger can be convicted of the taking of a vehicle without authority under section 112 of the 1961 Act and the same maximum penalties apply to both. The maximum penalties were substantially increased as recently as 1984. On summary conviction, they are a fine of £1,000 or imprisonment for a term not exceeding twelve months or both the fine and imprisonment. The 1984 legislation also introduced the possibility of conviction on indictment with a maximum fine of £2,000 or imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years or both. As to whether the legislation should be further strengthened, I am prepared to consider any views which interested parties may have as part of my current review of road traffic legislation.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Social Welfare if the method of means of assessment for unemployment assistance has been changed in recent months by his Department; if the allowance for mortgage or rent has been abolished where a claimant is married or otherwise; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Dr. Woods) Michael J. Woods
Speaker.P: The legislative basis for the assessment of means for unemployment assistance purposes is contained in section 146 of the Social Welfare (Consolidation) Act, 1981, as amended. This section was last amended by section 13 of the Social Welfare (No. 2) Act, 1985 which provided for equal treatment for men and women in matters of social security.

MainHeading.P: Prior to the implementation of the equal treatment provisions allowance was made for rent or mortgage payments where the wife of an unemployment assistance claimant was employed under a contract of service. The allowance, which was deducted from the net earnings of the claimant's wife, was made as a household expense when assessing the value to the husband as “head of the household” of his wife's income from employment. No such allowance was made in respect of unmarried claimants.

The Act of 1985, which came into operation in November 1986, provided for the deletion of the reference to the “head of the household” because the concept was incompatible with the principle of equal treatment. The amended legislation provides that the value to the household of all income earned by the claimant's spouse must be assessed as means. As rent and mortgage payments are of value to the household, they are not disregarded in assessing the spouse's income as means. Allowance is made, however, in respect of employment related expenses incurred by a spouse.

The Social Welfare (Preservation of Rights) (No. 2) Regulations 1986 provide for transitional arrangements for certain persons who were adversely affected by the equal treatment provisions. These regulations, which pending review have been extended until the end of this year, include provision for the continuation of allowances made in respect of rent or mortgage payments in assessing the value to a person as head of the household of his spouse's income from employment in cases where the claimant had been in receipt of unemployment assistance in November 1986.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly) Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.P: A proposal under the remedial works scheme has been received for the refurbishment of dwellings at Termon, Tangier and Mockmoyne, Boyle. As Roscommon County Council proposed that they would carry out refurbishment works at Termon initially, this project was approved in principle on 15 October 1987 and the submission of the necessary technical documentation and costings was requested. Pending the submission and examination of this data, and the necessary loan application, I will not be in a position to make a decision in regard to funding.
asked the Minister for the Environment the amount of finance available to Roscommon County Council over and above that which is already committed for 1988 for the granting of SDA loans.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: Roscommon County Council's capital allocation for 1987 for house purchase loans is £2,216,000. The allocations to individual housing authorities for 1988 have not been settled. However, the authorities have been advised, in connection with the arrangements for transfer of some of the demand for house purchase from housing authorities to provide sector lending agencies, that the capital available to individual authorities in 1988 would not exceed 60 per cent of the amount of the allocations for 1987.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Grant and Mortgage Subsidy Payments.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if the second instalment of a mortgage subsidy will be paid to a person (details supplied) in County Kilkenny.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly) Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.P: The first instalment of the mortgage subsidy will be paid as soon as possible. The second instalment will be paid when the applicant submits the claim form duly completed and certified by the lending agency.
asked the Minister for the Environment if a final inspection with a view to payment of a new house grant will be carried out for a person (details supplied) in County Kilkenny.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly) Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.P: There is no record of the receipt of an application for a new house grant from the person named at the address given.

asked the Minister for the Environment the number of companies involved in the disposal of toxic waste in the State; the amount of toxic waste disposed of in this country in any one year; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: Details of the total number of companies in this country involved in the disposal of toxic waste are not available in my Department. According to recently published figures approximately 66 per cent of toxic and dangerous waste arising here is disposed of by the producers on their own sites and a further 28 per cent is exported for disposal overseas. The remaining 6 per cent (about 3,000 tonnes) is disposed of by landfill either on local authority tipsites or by waste disposal contractors on their own sites.
asked the Minister for the Environment the plans, if any, he has for the establishment of a national agency to monitor the production, use and disposal of toxic substances.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: Matters relating to the production and use of toxic substances are outside my jurisdiction. Controls with regard to the disposal of toxic waste are the responsibility of the main local authorities, that is county councils and county borough corporations.
asked the Minister for the Environment when a house improvement grant will be paid to a person (details supplied) in County Clare.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly) Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of the Environment (Mr. Connolly)
Speaker.P: The grant will be paid as soon as possible.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Blackrock Vicinity Traffic Congestion.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if his attention has been drawn to the traffic congestion between Blackrock and the Merrion Gate, County Dublin; if he will consider the possibility of a contra flow traffic lane on Mondays to Fridays between the hours of 8 a.m. and 10 a.m. and between the hours of 5 p.m. and 7 p.m. in the evening; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn) Minister for the Environment (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: I am aware of the traffic delays occurring on this road at certain peak periods. When the Blackrock by-pass and ancillary works are fully operational and their effects can be properly evaluated, the local authorities concerned will consider what further measures may be necessary to relieve congestion, whether by way of traffic management schemes or road construction. In the meantime, the position is being kept under review by the authorities.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Employment Incentive Scheme Participant.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Labour the reason for refusing participation in the Employment Incentive Scheme in the case of a person (details supplied) in County Kildare who employed an extra employee on foot of information received from his Department but who has since been informed to the effect that he cannot qualify under that particular heading; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. B. Ahern) Bertie Ahern
Speaker.P: There is a regulation under the employment incentive scheme that an employer recruiting a person into an employment comprehended by an employment regulation order must pay a wage not less than the statutory minimum rate provided under the order. My information is that the employer did not pay the appropriate wage rate to the employee. In such circumstances the benefit of the employment incentive scheme cannot be extended to him. The employer's attention has been drawn to this requirement and if and when he notifies my Department of compliance with the order his application for payment will be re-considered.
asked the Minister for Health if his Department have discovered the source of the recent outbreak of hepatitis in St. Paul's College, Raheny, Dublin 5 and the Holy Faith Convent, Clontarf, Dublin 3.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. O'Hanlon) Rory O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: The Dublin Medical Officer of Health has investigated the reported incidence of hepatitis in St. Paul's College, Raheny and the Holy Faith Convent, Clontarf. Only one pupil in each school was found to be infected and there have been no further cases.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Primary School Entry Age.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education in respect of the Government decision of 1981 that four and a half years should be the minimum age of entry to primary schools, the annual Exchequer saving projected at that time in respect of (a) each of the following years to date, (b) 1988 and (c) the equivalent amounts which it is now estimated would have been saved in each of those years had that decision remained in force.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I understand that the Government at the time proposed the raising of the age of entry to primary schools on the grounds that it could be justified educationally. Details of costings that might be achieved from the measure are not available in my Department.

asked the Minister for Education whether it will be possible to maintain normal standard fire regulation requirements at a school (details supplied) in County Kildare after January 1988 if her Department goes ahead with proposed revised staffing arrangements; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The matter referred to by the Deputy would be one, in the first instance, for the board of management of the school. My Department have not been made aware of any particular difficulties in this regard in relation to the school.

asked the Minister for Education if there are sufficient funds still available in the 1987 Estimates to enable the carrying out of improvement works and extension of facilities at a school (details supplied) in County Kildare; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: My Department are agreeable to grant aiding certain improvement works and extension of facilities at the County Kildare school referred to, by way of short-term relief of its accommodation problems. The necessary architectural planning is currently being undertaken by my Department's professional advisers, and construction work will be put in hands as soon as this planning has been completed. The required funds will be allocated, and the question of their availability in the 1987 Estimates is not an issue. In fact it is unlikely that the grant expenditure will arise in 1987.

The Deputy is no doubt aware that plans for a major permanent extension to provide for the long-term needs of the school cannot at present be processed further because of the pressure on the capital funds available to my Department.

asked the Minister for Education if, following her recent meeting with the delegation from a school (details supplied) in County Kildare, she will grant approval for the carrying out of the necessary extension and improvement work to this school in 1988; if there is sufficient capital available for the carrying out of the work in the coming year; if her attention has been drawn to the urgent necessity for the provision of the extra facilities; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I am aware of the need for the extension and upgrading works at this school which is estimated to cost £1.12 million. The developed sketch scheme has been received in my Department and is under examination at present. The restriction on the relevant capital allocation, however, precludes expenditure on any new building starts. I am not, therefore, in a position to say when the proposed works will commence.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Waterford Sports Centre.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if the recommendation of the national sports centre committee, that a regional multi-sports centre be established in County Waterford and three other locations, has been accepted by her; if a decision to implement the recommendation has been taken; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: In the recent allocation of national lottery proceeds the Government made the following allocations in respect of the provision of regional sports centres at locations which were identified in the report of the National Sports Committee: Galway, £350,000; Cork, £300,000; Athlone, £300,000; Limerick, £250,000; Waterford, £300,000. The allocation which has been made for Waterford is in respect of the provision of a 400 metre synthetic running track to complement the large sports centre which has been built at Kilbarry, Waterford. My Department will be writing to the Waterford Corporation at the earliest possible date setting out the conditions for the expenditure of this allocation.
